title: Adobe's Revenue Rose 10% In Latest Quarter
text:
Shares of Adobe, down 42% this year through Thursday's close, climbed in after-hours trading.

The report comes as various business-software companies have indicated that customers are being more cautious on their spending plans due to a challenging economy.

In recent weeks, Salesforce Inc., Okta Inc. and others have said that customers are taking longer to sign deals, clouding the outlook for the once-booming business software sector.

Overall for the quarter ended Dec. 2, Adobe posted a profit of $1.18 billion, or $2.53 a share, compared with $1.23 billion, or $2.57 a share, for the same period of the prior year.

Stripping out one-time items, the company's earnings came in at $3.60 a share, ahead of analyst estimates for $3.50 a share, according to FactSet.

Revenue came in at $4.5 billion, in line with Wall Street estimates.

While Adobe left its outlook unchanged for its current fiscal year, it said it expects adjusted earnings of $3.65 to $3.70 in the current quarter. Analysts polled by FactSet expected $3.64.

It forecast revenue mostly in line with Wall Street estimates.

Adobe in September agreed to buy Figma Inc., a rival design platform that offers cloud-based collaboration tools, for around $20 billion. It still expects the deal to close in 2023.
